citations.narrative:
A current record of guinea pigs on hand was not available for review. There were no inventory records present for several
months indicating the number of adult guinea pigs, weanlings, and newborns present or the number of guinea pigs that
died. At total of 963 guinea pigs were counted during this inspections. Failure to maintain these records can make it
difficult to assess the health of the caviary by identifying animal losses by decreased number of guinea pigs born or
raised. Licensee must keep and maintain records containing the required information for animals which disclose the
number of guinea pigs held, acquired, or disposed of including births and deaths. Correct by March 26, 2023.

Space. Insufficient space was being provided to at least 133 weanling guinea pigs in 7 enclosures in rows 2 and 3.
Enclosures measured 24 inches by 32 inches or 768 square inches of floor space. Weanling guinea pigs weighing up to
350 grams require at least 60 inches of floor space each. This size enclosure can not house more than 12 weanling
guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams. These 7 enclosures were housing an average of 19 guinea pigs in each.
Inadequate space can cause stress and aggression in animals which can result in ear chewing, bites, and other injuries
from fighting. Licensee must ensure that guinea pigs are provided with at least the minimum amount of floor space per
animal to prevent stress, aggression, and discomfort. Remains uncorrected.

Housekeeping. The floor contains accumulations of spilled shavings, feed, excreta, and debris. There are accumulation of
dust, cobwebs, and dirt on the walls and ceiling in the animal room. Animal facilities must be kept in clean to ensure good
quality of the air for the animals and to prevent unnecessary disease risks. Ineffective cleaning and housing exposes the
guinea pigs to disease hazards and health problems. Correct by ensuring the premises are kept clean, including:
removing accumulations of shavings, feed, excreta, and debris from the floor; routinely dusting off and cleaning walls,
racks, and ceiling; and maintaining a level of general cleanliness to support good animal husbandry and health. Correct
by March 26, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section
